free: #e Hello
#c 你好
#n mihumisang是一個祝福, 意思是 “祝你活得健康, 快樂”
#e I am going to narrate, about the previous ancestral story.
#c 我要說以前祖先的傳說故事。
#e There is an old man, he planted various species of plants in many fields
#c 有一位老人種了很多的農作物。

gloss: 致使<重疊>種植=遠距.主格

free: #e What he planted the most satisfying one is the pear
#c 他的農作物中，他最滿意的是梨子。
#n sia < siamas 「就是」的意思
#e he planted pears, then the pears were fruitful
#c 他所種的梨子結實纍纍。
#e one day he thought of going to harvest the pears he planted
#c 有一天他想著要去採收他所種的梨子。
#e then, he carried his three baskets to load the pears
#c 然後，他帶著他的三個籃子要裝那裡的梨子。
#e as expected, he went to his field in early morning to harvest the pears
#c 他果然一大早出發去他的田裡要採梨子。
#n saicia < isaicia
#e He enthusiastically picking the pears from the early morning he gathered for two baskets the two baskets were full
#c 他高興地一直採收，從一大早一直採收了兩籃滿滿了 。
#n muz: 「滿」的詞根。
#e he thought there was still one basket hadn’t filled yet it was better to also load it because the pears he planted was extremely fruitful
#c 然後他想到還有一個還沒有，要把他採收的梨子裝滿，因為他所種的梨子太豐收了。
#e he thought to climb up again to pick the pears
#c 他想著再一次上去採他的梨子。
#n 這裡的ang可以是durative也可以是imperative，都說的通，但是因為是自己的想法，durative比較合理。
#e he was in the tree excitedly picking off the pears
#c 他在樹上很開心地一直採收。
#e there was a kid coming up he rode a bicycle passing through the old man’s baskets.
#c 有一個孩子騎腳踏車經過他採收梨子的農地。

gloss: 主焦-重疊-採收=遠距.主格
free: #e he didn’t see that old man
#c 那個孩子沒有看到那個採梨子的老人。
#e why there was two full under this tree two baskets full of pears
#c 為什麼樹下有兩個裝滿採下的梨子的籃子呢？
#e the kid looked around he found no one (around) he wanted to steal two pears but two pears were too few
#c 小孩看沒有人在看，他想要偷兩個，可是兩個太少。
#n uat < ung=at
#e he thought it was better to steal a full basket
#c 他想著：「我們乾脆偷走一籃好了。」
#e
#c 然後他仔細觀察，老人沒有看到他，他開心地拿了一籃。
#n madadaingaz 應該是講錯了，只有一個老人，應該是 ma-daingaz。
#e stole that basket carried it off
#c 他把這一籃拿走，放上他的腳踏車走了。
#n pudazaun <pundazaun
#e he thought wow I brought back home a basket of pears
#c 他想著：「哇！我帶了一籃梨子回家。」
#e he was so excited to bring the basket of pears that he had stolen
#c 他很興奮地偷拿走一籃梨子。
#e he met a pretty girl
#c 半路上，他遇見了漂亮的小姐。
#e he found that the girl was so beautiful when he looked back at that girl there was a big stone in front of him
#c 他看到這個遇到的小姐很漂亮，他回頭看那個小姐，不知道前面有個大石頭。
#n miliskin 是講錯了。palanduan=a 那個我所遇到的 palanduan=an 這個我所遇到的
#e his bicycle’s wheel hit the stone he fell off his bicycle
#c 他的腳踏車的輪子撞到那個石頭倒了。
#e meanwhile his hat also fell off
#c 他的帽子同時也落掉了。
#e when he fell off the bicycle pears in the basket also spilled out
#c 當他摔倒的時候，一籃的梨子也都撒出來了。
#e he was on the road sitting down to see his bleeding knee bleeding (knee)
#c 他在路上蹲下來看他受傷流血的膝蓋。
#e he squatted down and keep rubbing his knee
#c 他蹲著,一直揉他的膝蓋。
#e there were three kids beside the road they saw he fell down
#c 在路的旁邊有三位小孩子看到他跌倒。
#n sadu naicia 說錯了。
#e they thought to help that kid picking up his pears but there were too many pears cause all of them fell off the road
#c 他們心地善良，想著說；「讓我們來幫那個孩子撿起來！」因為一籃全掉出來，太多了。
#n =a 指那些掉下來的梨子
#e but those three kids really helped that kid they helped him picked up the scattered pears
#c 果然那三個孩子去孩子那邊幫忙撿他掉出來的梨子。
#n inaicia 講錯了，這句話可以不要用，要用的話要 isaicia 比較好。
#e gathered them in the basket and put it back on the bicycle they also help lift him up
#c 孩子也幫忙搬到他的腳踏車上，把孩子扶起來。
#e those three kids were really nice helped him out
#c 那三個孩子真的很好心地幫助他，
#e one of them at the same time throw the stone away throw it away across the street
#c 有一個孩子順便把路中間那顆車輪撞到的石頭丟在路邊。
#n ansasun順便: 順手牽走, 有輕鬆的意思)。asu; musasu: 順便。musasu ansahan mas kalala cia: 他順便把籃子抗起來。這裡的naicia應該是saicia。
#e they thought if there were other people passed through (this road) they might fall off like him
#c 因為他們想萬一還有別人經過也會像那樣的跌倒。
#e those three kids were really nice, they were good persons indeed
#c 他們真的是好，那三個孩子的心地真好。
#e and so they walked separately the one who stole the pears was also happy and left
#c 他們就這樣分別了，那個偷過東西的孩子也很開心，再次騎車走了。
#e in the half way those three kids yelled out “hey” they saw he forgot his hat, it was left on the road
#c 走到一半，那三個孩子看到：「哇！他的帽子忘在路上了。」

gloss: 可見.遠距-途中-那裡-那裡

free: #e he (one of the three kids) looked back and whistled they still could see him they yelled at the kid and whistled to him “please see”
#c 他回頭看，還看到他在那裡，他們吹口哨呼叫他：「呦！看這裡！」
#n daiza: 很遠但還看得到
#e the kid stopped and peeped out those three kids said: “here is your hat”
#c 然後，那個偷東西的孩子停下來回頭看，他說「你的帽子在那裡。」
#e they went back again to hand over his hat
#c 然後他們把帽子送還給他。
#e after getting the hat, that kid the kid who stole the pears he then felt grateful and gave them three pears
#c 那個偷東西的孩子拿到帽子後，心裡也覺得感激，他就給那孩子三個梨子。
#n dangian 在這裡是「擁有」的意思
#e and so they separated with joy
#c 他們很高興，就這樣分開了。
#e those three little kids they started walking from there
#c 那三個小孩子從那邊沿路邊走邊玩，經過那採梨子的那個老人。
#e They saw there are pears in the basket. However, they did not want to steal any.
#c 他們看見籃子裡有梨子，但是沒想著要偷。
#e They went through the way they were.
#c 他們就直接走過去。
#e Then the old man went down to fill the pears he had picked.
#c 那個老人下來要裝他所採的那個梨子
#e He was shocked: ‘Why one of them is gone? Aren’t there two filled up?’
#c 他嚇一跳，「欸？怎麼一個不見了？不是兩個滿了嗎？」
#e A basket was gone, and all picked pears were also gone.
#c 就一籃沒了，採過的梨子也不見了。
#e He wondered if there was any chance these three kids who just passed had stolen the basket?
#c 他在想會不會是這三個經過的孩子偷走了呢？
#e But he didn’t see the kids hold any, neither did he see the basket.
#c 可是沒看到孩子拿著什麼，也沒看到籃子。
#e The old man looked at the kids and thought about who stole one of his harvest pears.
#c 老人看著孩子想著說：「到底是誰偷了我採收的一籃的梨子呢？」
#e That’s it.
#c 就這樣
